User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; pt-PT; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Thunderbird/3.1.9

Users should have the possibility to request that their sent mail should not be archived. That would provide for the right to be forgotten for individuals, and also grant more information security for companies.

Reproducible: Always

Actual Results:  
No email sent has no information about the right to be forgotten, like what happens on the Usenet with the header X-No-Archive.

Expected Results:  
Mail header like X-No-Archive to request that mail messages should not be archived.

I wish that Thunderbird would add a setting to request mail servers and clients to not archive email messages. This would be similar to the Usenet X-No-Archive header, and would be a proposal to be honored by email servers and clients like the DNT (Do not track) Firefox header.

Another option would be to have headers to denote mail expiry date, similar to what Microsoft Outlook have, after which the mail would be removed from the server or mail client.

comments.text:
You can already add a custom header by adding a preference, but there's no UI yet :

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Custom_headers

The Mnenhy add-on can you with a GUI :

https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/thunderbird/addon/mnenhy/

Note that adding a header won't guarantee you anything, even if your mailserver support this header. Many countries have data retention laws, which *require* ISP's to archive your emails.
